title: Why Colombia Is Redesigning Its Natural Gas Network
summary: As domestic onshore supply continues to decline, higher LNG imports are a must for the country, and after 2031, it could have the option to produce offshore gas from Sirius, pending its FID. title: U.S. Reopens Venezuela’s Oil Spigot, but Refuses to Guarantee Security
summary: U.S. officials told oil executives on Wednesday that Washington will not provide security guarantees for companies operating in Venezuela, even as the Trump administration encourages the industry to re-engage with the country’s oil sector. title: New $2.5 Billion Agency Will Boost U.S. Critical Mineral Production
summary: A bipartisan group of lawmakers has proposed creating a new $2.5 billion agency to accelerate U.S. production of rare earths and other critical minerals, according to AP and MSN. title: Trump Could Offer Deals to U.S. States to Store Nuclear Waste
summary: The Trump Administration plans to offer U.S. states incentives for building nuclear reactors in exchange for agreeing to store nuclear waste, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.
